question: Which of the following investigations is used to differentiate cochlear from retrocochlear hearing loss?
Which of the following is the most likely cause of perforation of the bony part of the nasal septum?

A 70-year-old male patient presents to the clinic with complaints of feeling something sticking in his throat, difficulty in swallowing, and weight loss. He also gives a history of regurgitating undigested food 4 to 5 hours after consumption. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 25-year-old woman presents to the office with the complaint of nasal obstruction. Examination reveals a foul smell from the nose as well as roomy nasal cavities with greenish crusts. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A farmer develops long-standing late-stage atrophic rhinitis. Which of the following treatments is most preferable to eradicate the disease?

A 40-year-old male presents to your office with the complaint of a change in his voice. Fiber optic direct laryngoscopy reveals paralyzed left vocal cord in the paramedian position. Which of the following muscles is the main abductor of the vocal cords?
A 55-year-old male chronic smoker presents with complaints of hoarseness and dyspnea. What will be the most appropriate next step?

answers.option: Course of antibiotics and steam inhalation

question: A patient is found to have right ear subtotal perforation. Which of the following findings will be seen on tuning fork tests?

answers.option: False negative Rinne's for left ear

question: What is the extent of the parapharyngeal space?

answers.option: Base of the skull to the epiglottis
Base of the skull to the hyoid bone
Base of skull to lower border of mandible

question: What is the most common cause of oroantral fistula formation?
Which of the following is the gold standard investigation for the diagnosis of sleep apnea?

answers.option: Lateral soft tissue X-ray of neck

question: A 62-year-old male suffering from glottic squamous cell carcinoma comes to your clinic. Fiber optic direct laryngoscopy (FODL) reveals an exophytic growth on the right vocal cord. The right vocal cord is also fixed and immobile. Lymph nodes of the neck are not palpable. What is the tumor stage based on these findings?
Where is the sinus of Morgagni located?

answers.option: Between the skull base and the apex of the hyoid bone
Between the skull base and the superior constrictor
Between the hyoid bone and the floor of the mouth
Between the palatoglossal arch and the palatopharyngeal arch
Between the thyropharyngeus and the cricopharyngeus

question: A 75-year-old lady comes to the clinic with the complaint of decreased hearing bilaterally. Her blood pressure is 145/98 mmHg and her ear examination is unremarkable. What is the most likely diagnosis?

An 18-year-old male presents to the clinic with a diffuse swelling in the submandibular region, fever, ptyalism, and difficulty in chewing. He also gives a history of toothache. On examination, the swelling is diffuse, firm, and brawny with raised floor of the mouth. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A father brings in his 1.5-year-old child to the clinic with the complaint of inability to speak and unresponsiveness to even loud sounds. On investigation, it is found that the child has bilateral profound sensorineural hearing loss. Which of the following treatments is this child the best candidate for?

A 28-year-old female visits the outpatient department with complaints of restricted mouth opening, burning of the mouth, and intolerance to spicy food. She is habitual of chewing betel nuts for the last 12 years. Which premalignant condition is most likely to be present in this patient?

A 75-year-old lady reports to the emergency department with the complaint of dysphagia to solids following ingestion of her denture. She undergoes esophagoscopy under general anesthesia for removal of the foreign body. Following the removal, she starts complaining about sharp interscapular pain. Which of the following is the most dangerous complication of this procedure?

A 60-year-old man is suffering from a gradual loss of hearing with tinnitus. His audiogram shows a notch at 4 kHz for both air and bone conduction. It is symmetrical on both sides. Which of the following is the cause of his hearing loss?

A 60-year-old female with uncontrolled diabetes mellitus presents to the clinic with severe pain in her left ear. Examination of the ear revealed granulation tissue in the external auditory meatus. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 28-year-old woman, 26 weeks pregnant, presents to the outpatient department with complaints of ear pain for 2 weeks and discharge for 2 days. She did not have any convulsions or vomiting and the fever resolved yesterday. Which of the following antibiotics should not be given to this patient?

A 21-year-old female, who had been in a road traffic accident 4 days ago, presents to the outpatient department with complaints of persistent swelling, bilateral nasal obstruction, and pain. Examination reveals a bulge on both sides of the nasal septum. Her temperature is 100.5 F. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 65-year-old woman comes to the clinic with a 2-month history of difficulty in swallowing after taking 2-3 bites. She also complains of hearing a gurgling sound on swallowing and regurgitation of food contents at night. What is the most likely diagnosis?
An elderly man presents to the clinic with complaints of difficulty in swallowing and regurgitation of food contents at night. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Carotid artery, jugular vein, upper deep cervical nodes, 9th, 10th, 11th, and 12th cranial nerves pass through which of the following spaces?
Recruitment phenomenon is seen in which of the following diseases?
Which of the following landmarks will be used to start drilling when performing surgery for mastoiditis?

A 45-year-old malnourished lady is having difficulty swallowing for the past 6 months. Oral cavity examination revealed smooth tongue and fissures at both angles of the mouth. Which of these diagnostic tests are required in this patient?

A 60-year-old male is complaining of progressive worsening dysphagia for the past 3 months. He also noticed a change in voice and the appearance of a lump in the left upper part of the neck for two weeks. Which of these would you recommend as the first step towards diagnosis?

A 35-year-old female presents with deep orbital pain and frontal headache. There is also a history of long-standing chronic sinusitis. On cranial nerve examination, there is palsy of cranial nerves 6, 3, and 4. The vision is normal. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 20-year-old male had intense pain and itching in his right ear for 5 days. Ear examination revealed wet cheesy material in his right ear. What is the most likely diagnosis?
What is the best treatment for nasopharyngeal carcinoma (stage III)?
Which of the following organisms causes acute epiglottitis?

A 16-year-old boy presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of severe earache with bleeding from his ear. On otoscopy, the tympanic membrane has red, hemorrhagic bullae. There is a history of upper respiratory tract infection. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 25-year-old healthy female presents in the ENT outpatient department with the complaint of progressive increasing midline swelling of the neck for one year. On examination, it moves with swallowing. What is the most suitable radiological investigation for diagnosis?
A 7-year-old child has undergone a tonsillectomy. Just after a few hours of surgery in the ward. He develops bleeding from the operative site. What is the type of hemorrhage?

A 3-year-old boy was brought with the complaint of unilateral foul-smelling and blood-stained discharge from the nose for the last two weeks. What is the most important condition that should be suspected first?

A 62-year-old man came with a squamous cell carcinoma of the cheek on the left side with extension up to the lower gums. What is the most suitable investigation for assessing mandibular involvement in this patient?

answers.option: Plain X-ray face (AP and lateral view)

question: A 17-year-old boy presented with nasal obstruction, left cheek swelling, and epistaxis. Lateral X-ray nasopharynx is the showing anterior bowing of the posterior maxillary wall. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 16-year-old boy presented with right-side torticollis, a tender swelling behind the ear, and a fever. He has history of ear discharge for the past 6 years. Examination of the ear revealed a purulent discharge with granulations in the middle ear. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 25-year-old boxer was brought to the emergency room with a history of forceful punch by his opponent on the right side of his nose one and a half hours ago. On nasal examination, external deformity with the left deflected nose is visible. On anterior rhinoscopy left-sided deviated nasal septum without active bleeding is present. How will you manage this patient?

A 20-year-old boy is complaining of severe sore throat and fever and also difficulty in swallowing for one week. His family physician gave him oral amoxiclave, but his condition further deteriorated. Neck examination revealed bilaterally enlarged and tender lymph nodes. He is also complaining of upper abdominal discomfort. What is the most likely organism that can cause this condition?
A patient came with complaints of dyspnea in the emergency room. The doctor planned a high tracheostomy for his management. Which of the following is the indication of high tracheostomy?
Which of the following structures forms the medial wall of the tympanic cavity?
Which of the following is the first complete historic documentation regarding the ethical practice of a medical doctor?

The professor of Medicine was reviewing the proformas constructed by the resident trainee. The proforma contained a consent form, patients’ socio-demographics such as name, age, gender, address, and clinical details on the severity of disease, antibiotics used, and the clinical outcome of the patient. The professor is also the principal investigator of this research titled “Effectiveness of antibiotics in the treatment of gastrointestinal infections”. In the given scenario, which research ethics principle is at risk of violation?

An industrialist asks a public health specialist about the measures he can take, to control noises in the generator factory that he is going to set up. The public health specialist advises on the noise control measures at work according to the hierarchy of control measures. Which of the following is least likely to be advised by the specialist, since it is the lowest measure for control of hazard at workplace?

A 45-year-old male smoker presents to the emergency department with complaints of shortness of breath on and off for the last 1 week and a change in voice for 2 months. He also has significant weight loss as he could only swallow semisolid meals with difficulty for the last 3 weeks. What is your most probable clinical diagnosis?

A pus swab for culture and sensitivity is sent for a 28-year-old man who is suffering from atticoantral type of chronic suppurative otitis media (CSOM). What is the most common organism causing this disease?

A 61-year-old chronic smoker presents to the emergency room with noisy and troubled breathing. On examination, recessions are seen of suprasternal, subcostal, intercostal, and supraclavicular spaces. His oxygen saturation is falling. What is the treatment of choice?
A 6-year-old child during treatment of a respiratory tract infection develops severe pain in the right ear and conductive hearing loss. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A middle-aged male presents in outpatient with an earache, facial weakness, decreased hearing, and blebs on the ipsilateral external auditory meatus. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A middle-aged male who has a mild upper respiratory tract infection develops severe otalgia during air travel. What is the most likely diagnosis?
An 8-year-old boy is brought to emergency with a history of swallowing a coin. He is unable to swallow food bolus. What is the most appropriate investigation at this time?

answers.option: X-ray neck AP and Lateral view

question: A trumpet blower presents with compressible swelling in front of the neck. What is the most appropriate investigation?

answers.option: X-ray neck AP and lateral view

question: A 30-year-old male comes to the outpatient department with a complaint of frontal headache and deviated nasal septum. What is the most appropriate investigation at this time?
In a patient with complaints of progressive and unremitting dysphonia, dyspnea and loss of weight, what will be the most common etiological factor?
What is the common risk factor in allergic rhinitis?
What is the common etiological factor of epistaxis in old-aged people?
In a patient with oral fibrosis and decreased mouth opening, what is the most likely etiological factor?
What is the common etiological factor of malignant otitis externa?

answers.option: Viral infection of upper respiratory tract

question: What is the most commonly involved organism in malignant otitis externa?
In which of the following conditions tympanic membrane rupture can be seen?
Which one of the following is a cause of Rhinolalia Aperta?
What is the cause of bilateral nasal obstruction and septal bulge, following nasal trauma?
A 12-year-old presents in outpatient with a complaint of unilateral foul-smelling nasal discharge. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which one of the following can frequently be caused by blow from the front to the nose?
What is the most common site of foreign body impaction?
What is the most common complication of tonsillectomy?
Which one of the following is a cause of Quincy?
Which one of the following is a treatment for acute tonsillitis?

A 59-year-old male presented to the clinic with an area of depression in his mouth that has enlarged over the past six months. On examination, there is a 1.5cm x 0.8cm erythematous area with focal surface erosion on his left buccal mucosa. A biopsy of the lesion shows dysplastic squamous epithelium. Which of the following would be the most likely risk factor for the development of this lesion?

Which one of the following is the most likely disease of the otic bony capsule, characterized by the abnormal removal of mature bone by osteoclasts and replacement by the woven bone of greater thickness?
Which one of the following is the most commonly implicated etiology of nasal polyps?

A 30-year-old man presents in the outpatient department with the complaint of several vesicles on his upper lip. He gives a history of a bout of influenza a week back. The vesicles are approximately 0.3 cm with a clear fluid. Which one of the following is the most likely causative organism?

A 23-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with a painful swelling in front of his left ear, which was diagnosed as a mumps virus infection. What would be the most likely complication of this condition?
Which of the following tests is used to check for the patency of nasal valves?
Which of the following is a specific test used to diagnose allergic rhinitis?
At which point along the basilar membrane are the highest frequency sounds detected?

answers.option: At the midpoint of the membrane
At a series of widely spaced locations along the membrane
Farthest from the oval window, near the helicotrema

question: A 40-year-old male who works on an airport runway complains of hearing loss. On examination, loss of contraction of the stapedius and tensor tympani muscles is observed. Which of the following pairs of nerves likely supplies these two muscles?

A 35-year-old factory worker in Karachi, on his general check-up, is worried about noise-induced hearing loss. The physician advises him to limit his daily exposure to noise. According to local guidelines, what is the maximum limit of daily noise exposure which people can tolerate without significant damage to their hearing?

An important part of performing a procedure on a patient is to provide information to the patient needed to understand the procedure, including the nature and purpose of the procedure, as well as its risks, potential benefits, and alternative options. Which of the following terms best fits this description?

A professor while analyzing the data of one thousand covid-19 hospitalized patients noted that the average C-reactive protein values of male and female patients were 26.2 mg/L and 46.5 mg/L, respectively. To assess if there is a significant difference between the recorded C-reactive protein values based on gender, which of the following tests will be applied?

A professor notices a mean difference of 2 mg/L for C-reactive protein (CRP) levels between male and female COVID-19 hospitalized patients (total N=10000 patients, CRP levels male=46.5 mg/L, CRP levels female=44.5 mg/L and p-value=0.009). What is the probability of finding this difference in CRP between the two groups on chance alone?
Which of the following is the foremost objective of research ethics?

answers.option: To ensure the interest of the individuals

question: A vulnerable population is a group of people that requires greater protection against the potential risks of participating in research. They may have a higher risk of negative outcomes as they may have a reduced capacity or ability to give consent, or they may have special legal protections. Which one of the following is the most appropriate example of vulnerable populations?

A 20-year-old football player presents to the emergency room after trauma to his pinna. His pinna is swollen with a bluish discoloration. He does not complain of hearing loss. Which of the following is the most appropriate diagnosis?

A 22-year-old male complains of recurrent painful ulceration on the tip of the tongue, palate, and inner surface of lips. On examination, a superficial ulcer with a pale center and red periphery is observed. What is the most appropriate diagnosis?
A patient presents with a history of runny nose, sneezing, and nasal obstruction. On examination, there are multiple grey glistening masses in both nostrils. What is the likely diagnosis?
A 15-year-old child complains of hoarseness for the past two months. There is no history of cough or difficulty in breathing. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 35-year-old female presents to the clinic with the complaint of reduced hearing in both ears. The complaint worsened during pregnancy. Her pure tone audiometry and impedance reports reveal conductive hearing loss with a drop in bone conducting graph at 2000 Hz. Impedance shows As type graph. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 6-year-old boy came to the clinic with his mother with complaints of nasal obstruction, nasal discharge, and bedwetting at night. On examination, the patient had an open mouth, a pinched nose, and prominent incisors. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 39-year-old male with a history of tobacco chewing presents with a 4-centimeter-long non-healing wound on his right lateral tongue border. The surface of the wound is irregular and bleeds on touch. What is the gold standard diagnostic test for this lesion?

A 2-month-old infant is brought to the clinic with the complaint of noisy breathing with intercostal recession. During the examination, the noise during breathing disappeared when he was lying on his chest. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 31-year-old female presented in the outpatient department (OPD) with the complaint of swelling in the upper part of the neck below the jaw, which becomes painful and increases in size while taking a meal. What is the diagnosis?

A two-year-old boy was brought to the pediatric clinic with the complaint of a small skin-covered tag on a line drawn from the tragus to the angle of the mouth. Cartilage was felt under the skin on palpation. What is the most appropriate diagnosis?
A 25-year-old male suddenly clutches his neck with both hands during a dinner party. He is unable to produce a voice. What is the first step that should be taken in this case?

An 8-year-old boy presents to the clinic with complaints of snoring, mouth breathing, and decreased hearing. On examination, bilateral retracted and amber-colored tympanic membranes are observed. What type of graph is likely to be obtained on impedance audiometry?
Which of the following instruments can be used to remove a foreign body from the nose?
A young boy is brought to the emergency department by his parents with a history of ingesting a 2-rupee coin. Which of the following is the most appropriate initial investigation in this case?

A young male presents to the clinic with a history of fever, dry cough, and a muffled voice. During the laryngeal examination of a patient, a turban epiglottis is visualized. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following properties of sound is accounted for by the place principle of hearing?
A 4-year-old child presents to the emergency department with dyspnea and stridor. He has a history of ongoing upper respiratory tract infection. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A singer presents to the clinic with a complaint of hoarseness. On examination, a polypoidal growth is seen on the anterior commissure. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following statements is the most appropriate regarding the external auditory canal?
Which of the following is the most appropriate treatment option for stage III laryngeal cancer?
Which of the following treatment modalities for tonsillectomy is obsolete nowadays?
A 30-year-old male undergoes thyroidectomy. His voice is normal, but he developed stridor as soon as he was mobilized after surgery. What is the most likely cause of stridor in this patient?

A 57-year-old female presents to the clinic with complaints of sweating and flushing on half her face while eating. She gives a past surgical history of superficial parotidectomy on the same side a few months back. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 24-year-old male patient presented to the emergency department with a temporal bone fracture. He has facial nerve palsy. Which of the following temporal bone fractures is most likely to have an associated facial palsy?

answers.option: Hair line fracture with hematoma formation

question: Which of the following ion channels are opened when stereocilia bend towards the kinocilium?
Which of the following contains the auditory cortex?

A 35-year-old male presents to the clinic with bilateral nasal swelling. On examination, the skin appears to be hyperemic, and the swelling is tender. He also gives a history of frequent nose-picking. What is the most likely causative organism?
A 3-month-old child presents to the clinic with stridor which is aggravated by crying but gets better on lying prone. What is the most appropriate diagnosis?
What is the most important etiological factor for acute sinusitis?
A young boy from Afghanistan presents with complaints of fever, sore throat, and a grey membrane over his tonsils. How can the diagnosis be confirmed immediately?

answers.option: Throat swab for culture and sensitivity

question: Which approach is used nowadays for maxillary sinus surgery?
Which of the following structures is mainly responsible for the transmission of auditory signals?
Which of the following is an etiological factor for nasopharyngeal carcinoma?
Which of the following is the most appropriate initial therapy for malignant otitis externa?

An irritable female patient presents to the clinic with a meat bone stuck in her throat. She has been experiencing absolute dysphagia for the past two days. What is the most appropriate treatment for this patient?
Which of the following is the best treatment for anterior spur deviated nasal septum?
A 15-year-old male presents to the clinic with complaints of high-grade fever and a sore throat. On examination, the spleen is found to be enlarged. What is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?
Which of the following causes the appearance of Schwartze sign in otosclerosis?
A 56-year-old male presents to the clinic with the complaint of vertigo on turning his head to the left. There is no associated hearing loss or tinnitus. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following correctly identifies a paranasal sinus that will be radiologically visible at the given time?

answers.option: Sphenoid sinus at 1 year of age
Ethmoid sinus at 8 months of age
Frontal sinus at 6 months of age
Maxillary sinus at 6 months of age
Frontal sinus at 2 years of age

question: Which of the following is an example of a mass in the floor of the mouth that is associated with the obstruction of a salivary gland?
A patient is undergoing elective tracheostomy. He is given general anesthesia and is intubated before the procedure commences. What should be the ideal position of the patient for tracheostomy?

answers.option: Ring cushion alone is placed under the shoulders
Sand bag alone is placed under the shoulders
Sand bag and ring cushion are placed under the shoulders

question: Otoscopy of a known case of chronic suppurative otitis media reveals invagination of the tympanic membrane. What is the term used to describe this finding?
Which of the following organs is responsible for generating nerve impulses within the ear?
What is the most common cause of perforation of nasal septum?

answers.option: Prolonged use of steroids for nasal allergy

question: A 58-year-old man with a known comorbidity of diabetes mellitus for the past 10 years presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of developing sudden pain in the right ear with a fever. On examination, there is severe inflammation with small red swelling in the external auditory canal. The tympanic membrane is intact. The patient is most likely suffering from which condition?

answers.option: Squamous cell carcinoma of the ear

question: A 4-year-old boy was brought with the complaint of insertion of a smooth and rounded foreign body in his right ear. What is the most suitable instrument for the removal of the object?
A 50-year-old smoker presents to the ENT ward after thyroidectomy with complaints of dysphagia for 2 months followed by hoarseness. What is the likely cause of symptoms?
Why is septoplasty preferred over submucosal resection (SMR)?

answers.option: Can be done under local anesthesia

question: A school teacher presents with hoarseness of voice. What investigation will you perform?
Following a laryngectomy, what aspect should patients be specifically counseled about?
In a radical neck dissection, structures from which of the following regions are typically removed?
A diabetic patient presents to the clinic with a red mass in the ear and pain on moving the pinna. What is the most likely diagnosis?
When performing surgery for mastoiditis, what landmark will be used as the place to start drilling?
What is the extent of space of Morgagni?

answers.option: Space between base of skull and inferior constrictor muscle
Tensor veli palatini to levator veli palatini
Space between base of the skull to superior constrictor muscle

question: A 60-year-old male presents to the outpatient clinic with a complaint of nasal obstruction for 6 months. He has a history of a surgical procedure carried out for a nasal mass previously. On examination, there is a pale fleshy polypoid mass in the nasal cavity that bleeds on the touch. What will be the next step in the management of this patient?
A patient presents with a right vocal cord tumor. On laryngoscopy, the right vocal cord is fixed and the tumor involves the false vocal cord. What is the stage of his laryngeal cancer?

A patient presents with a right ear infection for 2 months. On examination, there is sub-total perforation of his right tympanic membrane. The left ear is normal. Which of the following is correct regarding his condition?

answers.option: False negative Rinne's in left ear

question: A patient with a motorbike accident presents to the emergency room with profuse nasal bleeding. What will be the last step in his management?

answers.option: Pinching the nose while bending forward

question: A person has been working in the industry for 15 years. He is surrounded by heavy industrial machinery. What is the most common auditory effect of long-term exposure to noise pollution?
How does mumps cause deafness?

answers.option: Otitis media due to viral infection

question: A 60-year-old male with diabetes mellitus and hypertension presents to the clinic with severe pain and hearing loss in his left ear. Examination of the ear revealed granulation tissue in the external auditory meatus. What will be his initial management?
